[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/ConsensusValidationContext.cs] [Property: CurrentRoundNumber] [Data Integrity] Can CurrentRoundNumber be set to a negative or zero value during context initialization, causing validation providers that check round transitions to malfunction and accept invalid round progressions? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/ConsensusValidationContext.cs] [Property: SenderPubkey] [Encoding Issue] Can ExtraData.SenderPubkey contain invalid bytes that cause ToHex() to produce a malformed hex string, leading to incorrect miner permission validation? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/ConsensusValidationContext.cs] [Property: BaseRound] [State Consistency] Can BaseRound be null when TryToGetCurrentRoundInformation fails, causing NullReferenceException in validation providers that directly access BaseRound.RealTimeMinersInformation? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/ConsensusValidationContext.cs] [Property: BaseRound] [State Manipulation] Since BaseRound is fetched from StateDb and modified by RecoverFromUpdateValue/RecoverFromTinyBlock before context creation, can a race condition cause BaseRound to be inconsistent with actual state during validation? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/ConsensusValidationContext.cs] [Property: BaseRound] [Data Corruption] Can BaseRound.RealTimeMinersInformation be empty or corrupted in StateDb, causing validation providers to incorrectly reject all miners or accept unauthorized miners? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Consensus.AEDPoS/ConsensusHeaderInfoValidationProviders/ConsensusValidationContext.cs] [Property: PreviousRound] [Term Transition] Can PreviousRound.TermNumber differ from CurrentTermNumber in unexpected ways, causing term transition validation logic to accept invalid term progressions?
